comments:
I'm editing Java and doing CVS.

A dialog box comes up:
File Changed
The File has been changed on the file system. Do you want to load the changes?

I saw yes, then these error come out:

Looks like the source viewer is null.

Do you reuse editors?
Sorry, what do you mean by reusing editors?

It's a preference:
Window > Preferences > Workbench > Editors
[] Close editors automatically

If the indicated limit is reached then the last open editor is reused.

The reason why I ask is that it looks like the editor either seems to be
destroyed or not yet correctly open.

Do you have exact steps to reproduce?

"Close editors automatically" is unchecked. I'm haven't encountered it again. I
was synchronizing with a remote CVS repository when it happened.

AbstractTextEditor$ElementStateListener posts element content changes into the
display thread, this is where RememberedSelection::remember is called. Since
this is posted, we might get a close event in between. Anything that can get
posted must protect against intermediate disposal.

ok, ok, intermediate was fine.

fixed > 20040223
